sect2.title: FAQ
sect2.para: If during the building of your LFS system you encounter any errors, have any questions, or think you found a typo in the book, please start by consulting the FAQs (Frequently Asked Questions) at .

sect2.title: Mailing lists
sect2.para: The linuxfromscratch.org server hosts a number of mailing lists used for the development of the LFS project. These lists include, the main development and support lists, among others.
For information on the different lists, how to subscribe, archive locations, and additional information, visit .

sect2.title: IRC
sect2.para: Several members of the LFS community offer assistance on our community Internet Relay Chat (IRC) network. Before using this support, please make sure that your question isn't answered in the LFS FAQs or the mailing list archives. You can find the IRC network at irc.linuxfromscratch.org or irc.linux-phreak.net. The support channel is named #LFS-support.

sect2.title: News server
sect2.para: All the mailing lists hosted at linuxfromscratch.org are also accessible via the NNTP server. All messages posted to a mailing list are copied to the corresponding newsgroup, and vice versa.
The news server is located at news.linuxfromscratch.org.

sect2.title: Wiki
sect2.para: For more information on packages, updated versions, tweaks, and personal experiences, see the LFS Wiki at . Users can also add information there to help others with their future LFS activities.

sect2.title: References
sect2.para: For additional information on the packages, useful tips are available at .

sect2.title: Mirror sites
sect2.para: The LFS project has a number of world-wide mirrors to make accessing the website and downloading the required packages more convenient. Please visit the LFS website at for a list of current mirrors.

sect2.title: Contact information
sect2.para: Please direct all your questions and comments to one of the LFS mailing lists (see above).
